tool_description: API to find all news mentioning COVID -19. You can filter news by topic, language, country, website and time period. By newscatcherapi.com
name: COVID-19 News
title: COVID-19 News

api_list.name: /v1/covid
api_list.description:
Highly customizable search through our database of news only on the next specific keywords: 
`covid`,`covid-19`, `coronavirus`, `коронавирус`, `koronavirüs`, `koronavirüs`, `coronavirüs`, `التاجى`
All filters and sorting options are allowed.

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description:
A word to search on from the list :
`covid`,`covid-19`, `coronavirus`, `коронавирус`, `koronavirüs`, `koronavirüs`, `coronavirüs`, `التاجى`

optional_parameters.name: media
optional_parameters.description:
Adds to the output of the call two more variables: `media` and `media_content`

Media - the main image published with an article 

media_content  - a comma-separated string of all images used in an article

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the search.  Allowed values are:
 `af`, `ar`, `bg`, `bn`, `ca`, `cs`, `cy`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fa`, `fi`, `fr`, `gu`, `he`,
`hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `it`, `ja`, `kn`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `mk`, `ml`, `mr`, `ne`, `nl`, `no`, `pa`, `pl`,
`pt`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `so`, `sq`, `sv`, `sw`, `ta`, `te`, `th`, `tl`, `tr`, `uk`, `ur`, `vi`.
Specifying the language will make your search more relevant

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description:
From which point in time to start the search. No specific format is required. 
E.g. (`2020/05/01`, `2020-05-01` ,`2020-05-01 12:54:14`, `2020-05-01 4:15am`, `yesterday 2:02 am`, `2020/05/01 12:55 EST`) .
The default timezone is UTC. **Defaults to one week ago at midnight UTC.**

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The number of the page. Use it to scroll through the results. Defaults to 1

optional_parameters.name: search_in
optional_parameters.description: By default, we search what you specified in `q` in both `title` and `summary` of the article. However, you can limit this to either `title` or `summary`

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: Until which point in time to search for. The default timezone is UTC

optional_parameters.name: topic
optional_parameters.description:
The topic to which you want to restrict the articles of your choice. This parameter is [experimental]. Accepted values are `news`, `sport`, `tech`, `world`, `finance`, `politics`, `business`, `economics`, `entertainment`
`news` usually means a general news feed (main headlines of a website).
> Important: this parameter is [experimental]. Not all news articles are assigned with a `topic`, therefore, we cannot guarantee that 100% of topics talking about technology will be assigned a `tech` label.
> One topic at a time, for example `topic=sport`

optional_parameters.name: not_sources
optional_parameters.description:
One or more sources to be excluded from the search. 
> Comma separated string, for example `not_sources=nytimes.com,cnn.com,wsj.com`

optional_parameters.name: to_rank
optional_parameters.description: Upper boundary of the rank of news website to filter by

optional_parameters.name: from_rank
optional_parameters.description: Lowest boundary of the rank of news website to filter by. **Important**: lower rank means that a source is more popular

optional_parameters.name: sort_by
optional_parameters.description:
- `relevancy` — the most relevant results first, 
- `date` — the most recently published results first, 
- `rank` — the results from the highest-ranked sources first

optional_parameters.name: page_size
optional_parameters.description: How many articles to return per page. Defaults to 50, max is 100

optional_parameters.name: sources
optional_parameters.description:
One or more news resources to filter your search. It should be the normal form of the URL, for example, **[nytimes.com](http://nytimes.com/)**, **[theguardian.com](http://theguardian.com/)**
> Comma separated string, for example `sources=nytimes.com,cnn.com,wsj.com`

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: The country to which you want to narrow your search. This parameter is [experimental]. We advise you to use it in conjunction with the `lang` parameter. Accepts any [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) codes

optional_parameters.name: ranked_only
optional_parameters.description: Limit the search only for the sources which are in top 1 million online websites. Defaults to `True` (`False` if you want to turn it off). Unranked sources are assigned a rank that equals to `999999`
